channel.title: Free Runescape Memberships,Possible I Believe
channel.description:
Ok i'v been thinking about this alot.I believe i have come up with somewhat of a solution.
1.Go to a payphone and ring your mobile phone.
2.Usualy on mobiles the number calling you is displayed,write it down.(Or find the number somewhere on the phone),
3.In Australia theres a 1800 REVERSE thing where the charge gets reverse charged to the reciever as long as they [b]accept[/b].Ring that 1800 REVERSE and get the free call to your mobile.On your mobile,pickup and accept the call then foward it to jagex number(Or conference call).
4.If im correct the charge will be given to Jagex LTD if it is fowarded,or fowarded beforehand.Sometimes fowarding isnt even needed.I ight test this later.
What do you guys think?

item.title: Free Runescape Memberships,Possible I Believe
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Optixs:

This has been discussed within many communities already. It dosent work because if the person that owns the phone/payphone dosent recognize “Runescape Membership” on their bill (whenever they actually get the bill) they can just cancel the payment, and/or claim un-authorized transactions within their account and then your runescape character is banned.

Fuck, it better not appear on the bill. I’ve used the phone so many times without asking for RS members. When I used to play anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Free Runescape Memberships,Possible I Believe
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

How about you guys just use your own phones and pay for it. It doesn’t cost that much anyways. If you guys can afford any mobile phones, you can afford a RuneScape membership.

This “free” method wont work, just think about all the details carefully and you’ll see why.

item.title: Free Runescape Memberships,Possible I Believe
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

No talking of Rep! It doesn’t work because you need to enter an area code! Paysurf wouldn’t have an area code seeing as it is an international BUSINESS.

Also, the reciever has to accept the Reverse charge. So, actually, it wouldn’t work.
